edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.graph.component

Class GraphLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.graph.component.GraphLayout

  • public class GraphLayout
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fitWindow()
      Scales the node positions so that the rightmost node is close to the right boundary of the window and the bottom-most node is close to the bottom of the window.
      void forceDirected()
      Repositions the graph so that the nodes are arranged in an aesthetically pleasing way.
      void nudgeToEdge()
      Moves all of the nodes to the top and left edges of the screen
      void scale(double xScale, double yScale)
      changes positions of the nodes so that the width of the graph is xScale times the current width and the height is yScale times the current height
      void scaleToWindow()
      Scales the graph to the current window size

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • scale

        public void scale(double xScale,
                  double yScale)
        changes positions of the nodes so that the width of the graph is xScale times the current width and the height is yScale times the current height
        To do:
        implement fitToWindow() to scale using current window width and height zoom( double factor ) to scale both width and height the same way not clear whether scale should be based on "original" positions or ones determined by algorithm

      • fitWindow

        public void fitWindow()
        Scales the node positions so that the rightmost node is close to the right boundary of the window and the bottom-most node is close to the bottom of the window. "Close to" is defined by the WINDOW_PADDING constant.

      • nudgeToEdge

        public void nudgeToEdge()
        Moves all of the nodes to the top and left edges of the screen

      • scaleToWindow

        public void scaleToWindow()
        Scales the graph to the current window size

      • forceDirected

        public void forceDirected()
        Repositions the graph so that the nodes are arranged in an aesthetically pleasing way.
        See Also:
        Force-Directed Algorithms (2006); Hu, Yifan
